6.3.5 Okkiyam Thuraipakkam

Figure 6.9: Okkiyam Thuraipakkam in 2002
Source: (Jayaraman, 2015)

Okkiyam Maduvu is a narrow chicken's neck water-course that facilitates tidal
exchange in the marshland of Pallikaranai. The Chennai authorities instead of
leaving a health buffer around the Maduvu permitted IT companies, apartment
complexes for IT employees, and the Kannagi Nagar colony to come up close to
where flood waters converge to pour into the Maduvu. These areas were badly
affected during the floods.
